instructions: 1 Open your Android's Settings Image titled Android7settings.png . You'll usually find it in the app drawer or on the notification tray. If your Android came with McAfee preinstalled (common with employer-issued Androids), it cannot be removed. [4] 2 Tap . This may be called Security or Security & Privacy on some Androids. 3 Tap . If you don t see this, look for Device admin apps or Phone administrators . 4 Tap to deselect it. This removes the checkmark beside the app. You can now return to your home screen. 5 Open McAfee Mobile Security on your Android. It's the red and white icon that says "McAfee" in the app drawer. 6 Tap the Menu . It's the three horizontal lines at the top-right corner of the screen. 7 Tap . If you don't see this option, you may have to tap More or a series of dots to expand additional options. 8 Follow the on-screen instructions to confirm. Once the process is complete, the app will be removed from your Android. Advertisement

1 Tap and hold the McAfee Mobile Security app on your home screen. It's the red and white icon that says "McAfee". A pop-up menu will appear. If you're using an older version of iOS, the icons may begin to wiggle. 2 Tap . A confirmation message will appear. If you're looking at a screen full of wiggling icons, tap the X at the top corner of McAfee. 3 Tap to confirm. This removes McAfee from your phone or tablet. Advertisement
